Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label at least two different habitats, such as a land habitat (like a garden or forest) and a water habitat (like a pond or stream).
The student can include and label different living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and animals like lizards, squirrels, fish, or clams.
The student can show comparisons by illustrating at least one living thing that is unique to each habitat and one that can be found in both habitats.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly represent the diversity of plants and animals in each habitat.
The student can use patterns in their drawings to show differences and similarities in life forms across different habitats, reinforcing observable patterns in nature.
